overview: A flicker film with a musical structure. In fast single-frame mode, images change separated by black. Individual objects appear for varying lengths of time and are repeated in the same shot a different number of times. The black shots, like the images, are made up of precisely counted single frames. As a result, a rhythmically alternating sequence of images is produced, which, due to the interruption by black, causes the so-called flicker effect.
title: Objekte (Flickerfilm)
